text: Pre-Lecture Quiz, Chapter 46, Urinary Tract Anti-Infectives and Other Urinary Drugs True/False 1. Prostatitis is inflammation of the prostate gland. 2. Urinary tract infections are rare in the elderly. 3. A bactericidal is a drug or agent that destroys or kills bacteria. 4. Anti-infectives are contraindicated in clients with intestinal or gastric blockage. 5. When a urinary tract infection has been diagnosed, urine culture and sensitivity tests are performed to determine bacterial sensitivity to the drugs. Fill in the Blank 1. Painful or difficult urination is called _____________. 2. The most common structure affected by a urinary tract infection is the _______. 3. Because the female urethra is considerably ________ than the male urethra, women are affected by UTIs much more frequently than men. 4. The anti-infectives used are the same as for other bacterial infections, although taken ________, they do not achieve significant levels in the bloodstream. 5. ____________, a topical analgesic, is a dye that can permanently stain clothing.
